DataElement.preferredName: Calcium And D Vitamin Dietary Supplement Past 30 Days Missed Medicine Dose Because Forgot How Often Type
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The response that indicates how often, in the past month, a person forgot to take the prescribed calcium and vitamin D supplements.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Calcium And D Vitamin Dietary Supplement Past 30 Days Missed Medicine Dose Because Forgot
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08._An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence._Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets._Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites._A period of time consisting of the 30 days before the present._A question about whether an individual missed their dose of medicine because they forgot.

ObjectClass.preferredName: Calcium And D Vitamin Dietary Supplement
ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08.:An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.:Vitamin D. The vitamin that mediates intestinal calcium absorption, bone calcium metabolism, and probably muscle activity. It usually acts as a hormone precursor, requiring 2 stages of metabolism before reaching actual hormonal form. It is isolated from fish liver oils and used in the treatment and prevention of rickets.:Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

Concepts.definition: An element with atomic symbol Ca, atomic number 20, and atomic weight 40.08.
An article which expresses the relation of connection or addition. It is used to conjoin a word with a word, a clause with a clause, or a sentence with a sentence.

A family of lipo-soluble steroids important to the absorption, metabolism, and function of calcium and phosphorus and the growth and development of bone and tooth enamel. Found naturally in animal tissues, cholecalciferol (vitamin D3) is formed in the skin when ultraviolet light activates cholesterol conversion into vitamin D3. Ultraviolet irradiation of ergosterol (plant vitamin D) forms ergocalciferol (vitamin D2). (NCI04)
Oral preparations containing dietary ingredient(s) intended to supplement the diet.  Dietary ingredients include vitamins, minerals, herbs, amino acids, extracts and metabolites.

ReferenceDocuments.name: In the past month, how often
